org.apache.distributedlog.api

Interface DistributedLogManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsyncCloseable, AutoCloseable, Closeable

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public interface DistributedLogManager
extends AsyncCloseable, Closeable
    A DistributedLogManager is responsible for managing a single place of storing edit logs. It may correspond to multiple files, a backup node, etc. Even when the actual underlying storage is rolled, or failed and restored, each conceptual place of storage corresponds to exactly one instance of this class, which is created when the EditLog is first opened.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.distributedlog.io.AsyncCloseable

        CLOSE_FUNC, CLOSE_FUNC_IGNORE_ERRORS, NULL

      • getAsyncLogReaderWithLock

        CompletableFuture<AsyncLogReader> getAsyncLogReaderWithLock(DLSN fromDLSN)
        Get a log reader with lock starting from fromDLSN.

        If two readers tried to open using same subscriberId, one would succeed, while the other will be blocked until it gets the lock.

        Parameters:
        fromDLSN - start dlsn
        Returns:
        async log reader

      • getAsyncLogReaderWithLock

        CompletableFuture<AsyncLogReader> getAsyncLogReaderWithLock(DLSN fromDLSN,
                                                            String subscriberId)
        Get a log reader with lock starting from fromDLSN and using subscriberId.

        If two readers tried to open using same subscriberId, one would succeed, while the other will be blocked until it gets the lock.

        Parameters:
        fromDLSN - start dlsn
        subscriberId - subscriber id
        Returns:
        async log reader

      • getAsyncLogReaderWithLock

        CompletableFuture<AsyncLogReader> getAsyncLogReaderWithLock(String subscriberId)
        Get a log reader using subscriberId with lock. The reader will start reading from its last commit position recorded in subscription store. If no last commit position found in subscription store, it would start reading from head of the stream.

        If the two readers tried to open using same subscriberId, one would succeed, while the other will be blocked until it gets the lock.

        Parameters:
        subscriberId - subscriber id
        Returns:
        async log reader

        boolean isEndOfStreamMarked()
                     throws IOException
        Check if an end of stream marker was added to the stream A stream with an end of stream marker cannot be appended to
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • delete

        void delete()
     throws IOException
        Delete the log.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the deletion fails

      • purgeLogsOlderThan

        void purgeLogsOlderThan(long minTxIdToKeep)
                 throws IOException
        The DistributedLogManager may archive/purge any logs for transactionId less than or equal to minImageTxId. This is to be used only when the client explicitly manages deletion. If the cleanup policy is based on sliding time window, then this method need not be called.
        Parameters:
        minTxIdToKeep - the earliest txid that must be retained
        Throws:
        IOException - if purging fails

      • getSubscriptionsStore

        SubscriptionsStore getSubscriptionsStore()
        Get the subscriptions store provided by the distributedlog manager.
        Returns:
        subscriptions store manages subscriptions for current stream.
